intro: Hibiscus fryxellii var. mollis, commonly known as the silky hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that give it a soft, velvety texture. Its flowers typically bloom in shades of pink to red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hibiscus fryxellii var. mollis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
